title.rendered: THE AMERICAN Rodeo 2022 live stream, how to watch, date, time

content.rendered:
The AMERICAN Rodeo has become one of the most anticipated and competitive events in rodeo. On Sunday, March 6, RFD-TV’s The American rodeo returns to AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas. The event is lauded as “the world’s richest one-day rodeo,” handing out $3 million in total. Attracting thousands of world’s top rodeo athletes to compete this weekend in team roping, barrel racing, steer wrestling, tie down roping, bareback riding, saddle bronc, and bull riding.

THE AMERICAN Rodeo 2022
Venue AT&T Stadium, Arlington, Texas
Dates March 1 – 6, 2022
Broadcast RFD-TV, Cowboy Channel +
Live stream Watch here

If you’re not already en route to Texas to watch The American 2022 live from the stands, you might be wondering how to catch it on the small screen. Well, RFD-TV’s naming rights might give you one clue: the cable channel will air the live finals event all afternoon Sunday into the evening. But there are other ways to catch the events leading up to Sunday’s big finale. Here’s the lowdown:

What channel is the American Rodeo on?

The Cowboy Channel, RFD-TV, Rural Radio Channel 147 on SiriusXM, and FloRodeo.com bring you complete TV coverage of THE AMERICAN and the Semi-Finals!

How to watch the American Rodeo 2022?

RFD-TV’s The American Finals are just away! For those of you who can’t join us at AT&T Stadium for the rodeo, here’s how you can watch all of the action LIVE. Both RFD-TV and The Cowboy Channel will be broadcasting The American live on Sunday. Note that all times are Eastern.

Below is a full schedule of events.

SUNDAY, FEB. 27

  • Roughstock Preliminary Round
  • Start time: 8 PM ET
  • Location: Cowtown Coliseum

TUESDAY, MARCH 1 – THURSDAY, MARCH 3

  • Semifinals
  • Start time: 8 PM ET
  • Location: Cowtown Coliseum

FRIDAY, MARCH 4

  • The American Finals Contender Round
  • Start time: 8 PM ET
  • Location: Cowtown Coliseum

SUNDAY, MARCH 6

  • The American Long Go
  • Start time: 1 PM ET
  • Location: AT&T Stadium

The American Short Go

  • Start time: 4 PM ET
  • Location: AT&T Stadium

The American Rodeo Finals 2022 live streaming

The official channel for The American Rodeo 2022 will be on The Cowboy Channel, RFD-TV, RIDE TV. Therefore, make sure that you subscribe to RFD-TV not to miss on the most anticipated and competitive event. For those who wish to live stream online the American Rodeo 2022 event, you can watch The American Rodeo Finals here.

How to watch the American Rodeo online Without Cable

Rodeo fans in the United States can also view the event without cable. We will highlight the significant TV streaming services that you can get the RFD-TV, where you will be able to watch the American Rodeo 2022 online.

You can stream RFD TV with a live TV streaming service. No cable or satellite subscription needed. Start watching with a free trial. AT&T TV includes RFD TV as part of their Entertainment package for $69.99 a month. AT&T TV has replaced AT&T TV NOW, which is no longer available to new subscribers. Sling TV includes RFD TV as part of their Sling Orange Heartland Extra package for $41 a month.

From the Tailgate Party to the Pre-Show to the rodeo performances, The Cowboy Channel and RFD-TV are bringing you all of The American action LIVE for the next 11 days!

If you don’t get The Cowboy Channel and want to watch all of the original programming surrounding The American Rodeo, as well as the slack rounds, you can subscribe to the PRCA on Cowboy Channel+ app to stream it live or watch anytime on-demand at cowboychannelplus.com.

Teton Ridge, the pioneering new western entertainment brand offering consumers legendary and iconic sports, products, and experiences, announced a broadcast partnership with leading national cable network INSP.

The network will air the richest single-day rodeo in the world, The American, live from AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas on Sunday March 6 at 4 p.m. ET.

In the weeks leading up to The American, INSP will also broadcast the world television premiere of Teton Ridge’s all-new action-packed, unscripted original series, “Guts and Glory.” The five-episode series will air on INSP every Sunday at 5 p.m. ET beginning Jan. 30 and running through Feb. 27.

“Guts and Glory” chronicles twelve rodeo athletes hailing from the Midwest and beyond, as they arrive in Texas to compete for the life-changing opportunity to compete for millions at The American alongside storied icons of the sport.

About INSP:  INSP is available nationwide to nearly 62M households via MVPDs including DISH (channel 259), DIRECTV (channel 364), Comcast Xfinity, Cox Communication, Charter Spectrum, National Cable Television Cooperative (NCTC), Verizon Fios (channel 286), AT&T U-verse (channel 564) and on vMVPDs including SLING TV, fuboTV, Philo, Frndly TV, Vidgo, SelectTV and Evoca.  Click here to find INSP in your area. INSP provides a trusted viewing experience with a lineup of exclusive and original series, timeless Westerns, action-filled dramas, and films focused on adventure and heroic characters.
